original_title: Sri Lanka bond yields steady at close
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s bond yields were steady at close on Thursday, while the interbank guidance peg remained unchanged.
“The investors must be taking a waiting approach with a bond auction coming on next February 27” a dealer said.
A bond maturing on 01.02.2025 closed at 32.10/40 percent on Friday, unchanged.
A bond maturing on 15.05.2026 closed at 29.50/80 percent on Friday, unchanged from Thursday’s close.
A bond maturing on 01.05.2027 closed at 29.15/40 percent on Friday, steady from at 29.10/25 percent.
The Central Bank’s guidance peg for interbank US dollar transactions depreciated by one cent to 362.67 rupee from 362.66 against the US dollar. (Colombo/Feb 24/2023)
